hadithText: "I twisted the garlands for the Hadi of the Prophet, then he did not assume Ihram, nor did he avoid any clothing."
"I put perfume with musk in it on the Messenger of Allah before he assumed Ihram, and on the Day of An-Nahr before he performed Tawaf around the House."
"I got my menses do the Prophet ordered me to carry out all the rites except for Tawaf around the House."
“Indeed Allah has made unlawful through suckling whatever He made unlawful through birth.”
hadithNarrated: Aishah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: “One sip or two sips do not make a prohibition.”
hadithNarrated: Abdullah bin Az-Zubair narrated from Aishah from the Prophet who said:

hadithText: Messenger of Allah said:"Whoever is tried with something from daughters, and he is patient with them, they will be a barrier from the Fire for him."

"Fever is from the heat of the Hell, so cool it with water."

Another chain reports similar narration.
hadithNarrated: Aishah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (S.A.W) said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah (s.a.w) did not eat his fill of barley bread on two consecutive days until he was taken (died)."
"The Messenger of Allah (s.a.w) had a leather cushion stuffed with palm fibres which he would lean on."
"I do not like to talk about anyone, even if I were to get this or that."
hadithNarrated: 'Aishah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w) said:

hadithText:
That the Prophet (saws) was asked about Bit' so he said: "All drinks that intoxicate are unlawful."


[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
that the Messenger of Allah (SAW) said: "Indeed among the believers with the most complete faith is the one who is the best in conduct, and the most kind to his family."
that the Prophet (SAW) ordered the closing of all the gates, except for the gate of Abu Bakr. And there is a narration on this topic from Abu Sa'eed.
that the Messenger of Allah (SAW) said: "Ammar is not given a choice between two matters, except that he chooses the one with more guidance in it."
that Jibril came to the Prophet (SAW) with her image upon a piece of green silk cloth, and he said: "This is your wife in the world, and in the Hereafter."
"Never was a Hadith unclear to us - the Companions of the Messenger of Allah - and we asked 'Aishah, except that we found some knowledge concerning it with her."
that the Messenger of Allah (SAW) said: "The virtue of 'Aishah over women is like the virtue of Tharid over all other foods."
"The Messenger of Allah (SAW) did not die until the women had been made lawful for him."
The Messenger of Allah (PBUH) used to observe fast on Mondays and Thursdays.[At-Tirmidhi].
hadithNarrated: 'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her)u reported:

hadithText: The Messenger of Allah (PBUH) used to remember Allah at all times.[Muslim].
hadithNarrated: 'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) reported:

hadithText: The conduct of the Prophet (PBUH) was entirely according to the Qur'an.[Muslim in a long Hadith].
hadithNarrated: 'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:

hadithText: The Messenger of Allah (SAW) prayed during an eclipse in a shaded area near Zamzam, bowing four times and prostrating four times.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that:

hadithText: When it rained the Messenger of Allah would say: "Allahummaj'alhu Sayyiban nafi`a. (O Allah, make it beneficial rain)."
"The Prophet (SAW) did not die until most of his prayers were offered sitting down."
hadithNarrated: Abu Salamah narrated that Aishah told him:

hadithText: Aishah told him: "The Messenger of Allah (SAW) would not say the taslim for two rak'ahs during witr."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Sa'd bin Hisham, that:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah (SAW) used to pray nine (rak'ahs) at night, then when he grew older and put on weight he prayed seven."
The Prophet (SAW) used to pray eleven rak'ahs at night, of which one was witr, then he would lie down on his right side.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that:

hadithText: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Can I not enter the House?' He said: 'Enter the Hijr for it is part of the House.'"
"There are five which the Muhrim may kill: snakes, mice, kites, speckled crows and vicious dogs."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that the Prophet said:

hadithText: "I remember twisting the garlands for the sacrificial sheep of the Messenger of Allah, then he sent them and stayed with us as a non-Muhrim (not in a state of Ihram)."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: "I twisted the garlands for the Budn of the Messenger of Allah, then he did not enter at state of Ihram or abandon any kind of regular clothing."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: "I used to twist the garlands of the Hadi of the Messenger of Allah, then he would stay with his family and not enter Ihram."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: "I used to put perfume on the Messenger of Allah when he entered Ihram, using the best perfume I could find.
"The Messenger of Allah did not fast any month more than Shaban; he used to fast (all of) it, or most of it."
the Messenger of Allah entered upon 'Aishah and said: "Do you have any food?" a similar report.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Mujahid and Umm Kulthum that:

hadithText: "I would own fasts from Ramadan and I would not make them up until Shaban came."
"Hamzah asked the Messenger of Allah: 'O Messenger of Allah, should I fast while then fast and if you wish then do not fast."'
"The Messenger of Allah did not fast in any month of the year more than he did in Shaban. He used to fast all of Shaban."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah did not ofer gthe funeral prayer for shail bin Baida anywhere but in the Masjid."
"The Messenger of Allah said: 'Prompt your dying ones to say La ilaha illahllah (there is none worthy of worship except Allah)."'
It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah married her when she was six years old, and consummated the marriage with her when she was nine.
"Aishah said: 'The Messenger of Allah married me when I was nine and I lived with him for nine years.'"
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Abu 'Ubaidah said:

hadithText: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah married her when she was nine and he died when she was eighteen years old.
"What becomes unlawful (for marriage) through birth becomes unlawful through breast-feeding."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet said:

hadithText: "What becomes unlawful (for marriage) through breast-feeding is that which becomes unlawful through lineage."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah married me when I was six, and consummated the marriage with me when I was nine."
the Messenger of Allah ordered that the hides of dead animals be made use of if they had been tanned. (Daif)
"Your children are part of the best of your earnings, so eat from what your children earn."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah bought some food from a Jew with payment to be made later, and he put his shield in pledge for that."
"The Messenger of Allah bought some food from a Jew on credit, and he gave him a shield of his as a pledge. "
"And it is upon those (relatives) of the killed one to block (any punishment) the first (in line) then the first, even if that one is a woman."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: "(The thief's hand) is not to be cut off except for the price of a shield, one-third of a Dinar or half of Dinar, or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: 'Used to cut off the hand of the thief for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah" (one of the narrators) Qutaibah said:

hadithText: "It has not been too long and I have not forgotten yet. Cutting off (the hand of the thief) is for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
she heard the Messenger of Allah say: "The hand of the thief is not be cut off except for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
"The Messenger of Allah said: 'The hand of the thief is to be cut off for the price of a shield, and the price of a shield is one-quarter of a Dinar."
"The hand of a thief is not to be cut off except for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that she heard the Messenger of Allah say:

hadithText: "The people who will be most severely punished on the Day of Resurrection will be those who try to match the creation of Allah."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that 'Aishah, the wife of the Prophet [SAW], said:

hadithText: The Prophet [SAW] said: "Do not soak (fruits) in Ad-Dubba', An-Naqir, Al-Hantam, and every intoxicant is unlawful."
"The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Every drink that intoxicates is unlawful.'" Qutaibah (one of the narrators) said: "From the Prophet [SAW]."
The Prophet [SAW] was asked about mead and he said: "Every drink that intoxicates is unlawful." And mead is a drink made of honey.
"I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbidding drinks made in Dubba' (gourds), Hantam or Muzaffat, that were not oil or vinegar."
"It is not permissible for a woman to mourn for anyone who dies for more than three days, except for her husband."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: "It is not permissible for a woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day to mourn for more than three days, except for her husband."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet said:

hadithText:
"There is nothing for this chapter which is better than this hadith, even though it is Mursal. And Al-A'mash reported this Hadith from Habib bin Abi Thabit, from 'Urwah, from 'Aishah.
Yahya Al-Qattan said: "This is the Hadith of Habib from 'Urwah, from 'Aishah. And the Hadith of Habib from 'Urwah, from 'Aishah: "She prays even if blood drips on the mat" is nothing.
hadithNarrated:
It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet (PBUH) used to kiss one of his wives then pray without performing Wudu'.
Abu 'Abdur-Rahman said:

hadithText: "When the time of menstruation comes, stop praying, and when it goes, perform Ghusl."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet (PBUH) said:

hadithText: "I used to perform Ghusl with the Messenger of Allah (PBUH) from one vessel, which was the size of a Faraq."
"The Messenger of Allah (PBUH) and I used to perform Ghusl together using one vessel."
It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah (PBUH) used to soak his head, then he would pour water over it three times.
"I used to scrape the Janabah." On another occasion she said: "The semen from the garment of the Messenger of Allah (PBUH)."
"When the time of menstruation comes, stop praying, and when it goes, perform Ghusl."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet (PBUH) said:

hadithText: "The first time the Salah was enjoined it was two Rak'ahs, and it remained as such when traveling, but the Salah while resident was made complete."
"The Salah was enjoined two Rak'ahs at a time, then the Salah when traveling remained like that, but the Salah while resident was increased."
"I prayed beside the Prophet (saws) and Aisha was behind us praying with us, and I was beside the Prophet (saws) praying with him."
When the Prophet (saws) came out of the privy, he used to say: "Grant me Thy forgiveness."
The Prophet (saws) did not get up after sleeping by night or by day without using the tooth-stick before performing ablution.
My hands and the hands of the Messenger of Allah (saws) alternated into one vessel while we performed ablution.
The Prophet (saws) would take a bath because of sexual defilement on Friday, after opening a vein and after washing a dead body.

The Messenger of Allah (saws) would not pray in our wrappers or in our quilts. 





Ubaydullah said: My father (Mu'adh) doubted this.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) said: Allah and His angels bless those who are on the right flanks of the rows.
Aisha was asked: Did you not see (i.e. known) the statement of Fatimah? She replied: It is not good for her to mention it (to others).
The Messenger of Allah (saws) was shrouded in three garments of white Yemeni stuff, among which was neither a shirt nor a turban.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) said: Breaking a dead man's bone is like breaking it when he is alive.
I heard the Messenger of Allah (saws) say: Every intoxicant is forbidden; if a faraq of anything causes intoxication, a handful of it is forbidden.
The water from as-Suqya' was considered sweetest by the Prophet (saws). Qutaybah said: it was a well on two days' journey from Medina.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) forbade to enter the hot baths. He then permitted men to enter them in lower garments.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) cursed mannish women.
hadithNarrated: Ibn AbuMulaykah told that when someone remarked to Aisha that a woman was wearing sandals, she replied:

hadithText: The Messenger of Allah (saws) Said: Forgive the people of good qualities their slips, but not faults to which prescribed penalties apply.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) spoke in a distinct manner so that anyone who listened to him could understand it.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) as saying: The right of inheritance belongs to only to the one who paid the price (of the slave) and patronised him by doing an act of gratitude.
I and the Messenger of Allaah ( sal Allaahu alayhi wa sallam ) took a bath from one vessel while we were sexually defiled.
The Messenger of Allah(may peace be upon him) would recline on my lap when I was menstruating, then recite the Qur’an.
I swear by Allah, the Messenger of Allah (saws) prayed over Suhail b. al-Baida' in the mosque.
I swear by Allah, the Messenger of Allah (saws) prayed in the mosque over the two sons of al-Baida': Suhail and his brother.
We bear witness that 'Aishah said: Not a day passed but the Prophet (saws) prayed two rak'ahs after the 'Asr prayer
Allah, the Exalted, would awaken the Messenger of Allah (saws) at night. When the dawn came, he would his finish daily round of recital.
This tradition has also been transmitted by 'Aishah through a different chain of narrators. But the tradition narrated by Hammad b. Salamah is not equal to the tradition narrated by others.
If I had some part of the fast of Ramadan to make up, I would not be able to atone for it except in Sha'ban.
The people (mostly) were workers and they would come for Friday prayer in the same condition, so it was said to them: If only you were to perform Ghusl.
The Messenger of Allah (saws) would offer the Zuhr prayer while the sunlight was present in her apartment before it ascended (the walls).
